definitions.text: an emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger (usually accompanied by a desire to flee or fight)

examples: they hushed it up out of fear of public reaction

definitions.text: a feeling of profound respect for someone or something
examples: the Chinese reverence for the dead
the French treat food with gentle reverence
his respect for the law bordered on veneration

definitions.text: be afraid or feel anxious or apprehensive about a possible or probable situation or event
examples: I fear she might get aggressive

definitions.text: be afraid or scared of; be frightened of
examples: I fear the winters in Moscow
We should not fear the Communists!

definitions.text: be sorry; used to introduce an unpleasant statement
examples: I fear I won't make it to your wedding party
I fear the results of the final exams

definitions.text: regard with feelings of respect and reverence; consider hallowed or exalted or be in awe of
